page.title: 02ARABLE FARMING IN BOOTHBY
page.content: Boothby's arable crops consisted mostly of wheat and barley with a few fields of hay.These had boundaries marked out by hedges,fences or trees.These crops could be used for cereal,trade,exports and drinks such as beer. The undulating ground varied in height from .265 _ .370ft. No evidence could be found of any recent changes in crops.The land was a mixture of slopes and flat in places. Machinery was used to spray,plough,sow and water the fields. The soil was fertile and the crops were growing well in rows.The machinery included tractors with sprayers,harrows,drills,hay baler and a combine harvester.
